intro: Antitaxis, commonly known as the "sea holly," is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its blue or purple flower heads. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
